text: ਰਾਗੁ ਗੋਂਡ ਬਾਣੀ ਨਾਮਦੇਉ ਜੀ ਕੀ ਘਰੁ ੧
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Gond, The Word Of Naam Dayv Jee, First House:

transliteration.text: rāg gōnhd bānī nāmadēu jī kī ghar 1

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: giving one's weight in gold to charities,

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. text: ਤਉ ਨ ਪੁਜਹਿ ਹਰਿ ਕੀਰਤਿ ਨਾਮਾ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: These are not equal to singing the Praises of the Lord's Name.

transliteration.text: tau n pujah har kīrat nāmā .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. text: ਅਪੁਨੇ ਰਾਮਹਿ ਭਜੁ ਰੇ ਮਨ ਆਲਸੀਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditate on your Lord, you lazy man! ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: apunē rāmah bhaj rē man ālasīā .1. rahāu .

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditate, O Naam Dayv, and cross over the terrifying world-ocean. ||4||1||
